GFD 2D Quick Start Guide

 

 

 First prepare the detector for operation.

 Adjust the high voltage by monitoring the amplifier outputs.

 Adjust each discriminator threshold to get NIM pulses.

 

 Then start the C111GUI-2D and follow the next procedure.

  

 + tools > Auto tune

 

   Check the transcript (pop up the black window)

   for errors like missing inputs...

   Fix errors (wrong cabling, adjust discriminators thresholds...)

 

 + Configuration pannel should pop up

   Enable the statistics interrupt

   Specify the refresh rate for interrupts (for ex. 2 seconds)

 

 + Tools > attach device if the device is not anymore connected.

 

 + Tools > Statistics display > run

 

   Monitor the live display

   Further adjust HV and discriminators in order to

   - maximize the event rate

   - balance the X1, X2, Y1, Y2 inputs

   - minimize the rejection of pile up events

 

 Loop back to the Auto tune menu

 until satisfactory results have been obtained.

 

 + From the bottom bar menu, RUN .

   An acceptable image should already be achieved.

 

 Next optimize the Offsets to get a well centered image.

 

 + settings > use current configuration

 

   adjust offsets

   check the APPLY button.

 

 + From the bottom bar menu, RUN .

 

 Loop back to modify offsets in the configuration,

 until the image is centered.

 It might be necessary to fine adjust the P111 memory area, too.

 

 + settings > use current configuration

 

   check the SAVE button

   and name this configuration for further use.

 

 This quick procedure normally let the configuration

 with a half resolution (300 ps) TDC and binning mode display.

 

 You may further improve the image quality

 (at the expense of the readout time).

 

 + settings > use current configuration

 

   Uncheck (disable) binning.

   The display doubles in (x and Y) size.

 

 You may further improve the image quality

 (at the expense of the readout time).

 

 + settings > use current configuration

 

   Check (enable) full resolution,

   and accordingly double the X,Y memory area size.

   The display doubles in (x and Y) size.
